course_title: Special Topics in Religion: Antisemitism & Hol Graph Novel

class_notes:
Same as JS 273-1 and HIST 296-7


Topic title: Antisemitism & the Holocaust through Graphic Novels
This is an introductory course on the Holocaust, its origins, implementation, and aftermath. Challenging popular myths and oversimplified explanations, we will view the genocide of European Jews as a historical event neither inevitable nor inexplicable and consider its implications for the present. Our particular window into the Holocaust history and representation will be diverse forms of visual storytelling, from medieval anti-Judaist images, through series of paintings created by Jews in hiding and American comic books from the 1940s in which superheroes fought Nazis, to second- and third-generation graphic memoirs.
course_description: Variety of subjects pertaining to religion. Content will vary in successive offerings. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
